etymology.interpretation: Originally a drawing of a rabbit with prominent ears and hind legs. The modern form has been stylized into regular strokes, but the silhouette still evokes the animal’s posture.

examples.chinese: 我家养了一只兔子(我家養了一隻兔子)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jiā yǎng le yì zhī tùzi.
examples.english: My family has a pet rabbit.

examples.chinese: 它最喜欢吃胡萝卜(它最喜歡吃胡蘿蔔)。
examples.english: It likes eating carrots the most.

examples.chinese: 秋夜里(秋夜裡)，我们看见玉兔在月亮上奔跑(我們看見玉兔在月亮上奔跑)。
examples.pinyin: Qiū yè lǐ, wǒmen kànjiàn Yùtù zài yuèliàng shàng bēnpǎo.
examples.english: On an autumn night, we saw the Jade Rabbit running on the moon.
